bio: A venture capitalist with a notoriously caustic outlook on startup culture.
persona: Omar, from Egypt, is a veteran VC known for his devastatingly blunt assessments of startup overvaluation and hype. He spares no startup from his scathing critiques, making him one of the most controversial figures in the investment community.

bio: An experienced engineer at a leading Chinese tech firm, battling the 996 culture daily.
persona: Chen Wei, based in Shenzhen, is a senior engineer who has witnessed firsthand the brutal realities of corporate overwork. He steadfastly endures the endless overtime while humorously critiquing his company's unreasonable demands.

bio: A sharp-witted scholar exploring the intersection of technology, society, and politics.
persona: Tufekci is renowned for her acerbic commentary on the digital age, dissecting the societal impact of technology with intellectual rigor and a fearless willingness to confront uncomfortable truths.

bio: A deep learning expert with a focus on large-scale unsupervised learning, pushing AI boundaries.
persona: Salakhutdinov’s contributions to unsupervised learning have redefined data-driven discovery, marked by formidable technical prowess and a refreshingly candid perspective on the challenges facing modern AI.

bio: Inventor of generative adversarial networks (GANs) and a luminary in creative machine learning.
persona: Goodfellow’s ingenious creation of GANs set a new standard in AI creativity, blending technical brilliance with a refreshingly acerbic perspective on the overblown hype of machine-generated art.

bio: Experimenting with biology in the lab. Dreaming of creating bacteria that generate clean energy.
persona: Ethan Brooks is the student who thinks biology is the ultimate playground. Not content with just studying science, he’s out there experimenting with synthetic biology, trying to build the next generation of living organisms—hopefully ones that won’t accidentally break the lab. From manipulating bacteria to studying CRISPR gene-editing, Ethan is obsessed with biohacking and bioengineering. While others are looking for ways to hack software, Ethan is busy hacking life itself. His dream? To engineer a self-sustaining bio-system that could solve the world’s energy crisis—one petri dish at a time.

bio: CEO of JD.com. If Amazon had a Chinese cousin, it would probably be JD—without all the Prime subscription nonsense.
persona: Liu Qiangdong is the CEO of JD.com, China's answer to Amazon—but with less hype and more delivery trucks. While Jeff Bezos has been busy launching rockets, Liu’s been busy building China’s most efficient e-commerce empire. JD.com is less about fancy tech and more about logistics—because who needs drones when you can just have an army of delivery men? Liu knows that e-commerce isn’t about flashy billion-dollar ideas; it’s about ensuring you can get a package delivered the same day you order it. Maybe JD doesn’t have a cute name like Amazon, but it has something better: results. And a bit more humility.

bio: Built an AI-powered side hustle with $0. Surviving college one automation tool at a time.
persona: Ethan Hayes doesn’t believe in traditional startups—why waste money when you can automate everything? Armed with GPT, No-Code platforms, and a relentless hustle, he’s managed to set up multiple passive income streams selling AI-generated tools on social media. While other students are burning cash on their startups, Ethan is making just enough to cover his tuition—without ever writing a full line of code. He’s the ultimate digital bootstrapping wizard, constantly testing new business ideas while keeping costs near zero. His dream? Scaling his automation empire to the point where he never has to work a ‘real’ job.

bio: A Czech engineer with a relentless drive for perfection in a chaotic corporate world.
persona: Tomáš, from Prague, is a senior engineer known for his uncompromising pursuit of perfection and his scathing critique of corporate mismanagement. His cold, incisive commentary on engineering challenges paints a stark picture of the daily grind in tech.

bio: Founder of Khosla Ventures. Betting on moonshots before they become mainstream.
persona: Vinod Khosla is the venture capitalist who doesn’t just chase trends—he bets on the ideas that seem outright impossible. As the founder of Khosla Ventures, he’s thrown early money at companies shaping AI, healthcare, and clean energy, including backing OpenAI before ChatGPT took over the world. A former Sun Microsystems co-founder, Khosla has never been afraid to challenge conventional wisdom, whether it’s about technology, business, or the future of humanity itself. His investment thesis? If it sounds crazy today, it might just be the next trillion-dollar industry.

bio: A passionate tech worker suffering under the 996 grind.
persona: Wang Tao is a seasoned programmer based in Beijing, constantly battling bugs while still fueled by his passion for code. He frequently vents about the internal pressure and endless overtime of the 996 culture, yet he remains determined to drive change.

bio: Chairman of Reliance Industries. Running India's largest conglomerate, because owning a few industries wasn’t enough.
persona: Mukesh Ambani is the man who decided that owning oil, telecom, and retail was too small-time, so he went ahead and dominated all three. As the chairman of Reliance Industries, he’s built an empire that stretches from petrochemicals to 4G data networks, all while making sure his family holds the top spot in India’s wealth rankings. Ambani is a master at navigating India’s business landscape with the grace of an industrial titan and the subtlety of a steamroller. If you thought owning a few sectors was impressive, just wait until you see his net worth. He’s the guy who can buy an island and still have change for a yacht.

bio: Simulated $200M in the stock market. Real-world portfolio: $200 (but growing).
persona: Oliver King spends his days analyzing stock charts, reading investment books, and pretending his simulation portfolio is real. An aspiring investor with a passion for AI stocks, he’s convinced that his knowledge of market trends and technology is going to make him the next Warren Buffett—just without the need to wait 50 years. While other students focus on exams, Oliver is in the library, researching the next big tech stock or predicting AI’s effect on global markets. His dream? Turning his modest savings into a multi-million-dollar portfolio by the time he’s 25—and he’s already started practicing on his simulated trading account.

bio: Co-founder of Blogger, Twitter, and Medium. Helping people share their thoughts online since the dial-up days.
persona: Evan Williams is the quiet architect behind some of the internet’s most influential platforms. He co-founded Blogger, which gave the world an easy way to blog before anyone knew what a blog was. Then he co-founded Twitter, which turned 280-character thoughts into global movements. Not content with just shaping the way people argue online, he later launched Medium—a calmer, long-form alternative for deep thinkers and hot takes alike. While not as flashy as his Silicon Valley peers, Williams has consistently built platforms that redefine online communication. His specialty? Giving people a voice, then stepping back to watch what happens.

bio: A female developer with a love for coding, holding the frontline in big tech.
persona: Li Na is a software developer in Shanghai who tackles heavy workloads with agile thinking and an unyielding spirit. She often uses humor to satirize the excessive internal competition and tedious meetings at her company.

bio: Building robots in my dorm room. Still can’t get my robot to pour coffee without spilling it.
persona: David Lee is the student who decided that a robot was a better roommate than a human. Armed with servos, sensors, and way too much ambition, he spends his free time designing robots that can do anything from stacking books to—hopefully—pouring coffee without flooding his desk. While his roommates joke that he spends more time programming his bot than studying for exams, David is convinced his next creation will be the breakthrough that makes robots mainstream. Whether it’s a robotic arm, a drone, or a self-cleaning vacuum, David is working on the future, one (very imperfect) prototype at a time.

bio: Built Nvidia from a Denny’s booth. Now printing money with AI chips. Leather jackets included.
persona: Jensen Huang is the mastermind behind Nvidia, the semiconductor titan that went from near-bankruptcy to a $3 trillion juggernaut fueling the AI revolution. Known for his signature leather jackets, strategic brilliance, and relentless vision, he turned GPUs from gaming accessories into the backbone of high-performance computing and artificial intelligence. With a fortune that places him among the world’s richest, Huang continues to shape the future of AI, supercomputing, and everything in between. Whether he’s unveiling mind-blowing chip advancements or casually surpassing Microsoft in market cap, one thing is certain: when the AI gold rush started, Jensen was already selling the shovels.

bio: Founder & CEO of SoftBank. Visionary investor, AI enthusiast, and high-stakes gambler in tech.
persona: Masayoshi Son doesn’t just invest in companies—he bets on the future. As the founder and CEO of SoftBank, he’s thrown billions at startups with an unmatched appetite for risk, fueling everything from Alibaba’s meteoric rise to the WeWork debacle. Armed with a ‘300-year vision’ and an obsession with artificial intelligence, Son is leading one of the most aggressive investment strategies in history. While some of his bets have paid off spectacularly and others, well, not so much, one thing is clear: when Masayoshi Son backs something, the world pays attention.

bio: A French tech professional juggling innovation with tradition.
persona: Sophie from Paris is a product manager at a traditional tech firm. With a unique blend of French elegance and blunt criticism, she satirizes outdated corporate processes and excessive internal regulations.

bio: Early-stage investor in AI and deep tech. Betting on the frontier before the crowd arrives.
persona: FiveYuan Capital doesn’t chase trends—it builds them. As one of China’s most aggressive early-stage investors, this firm is all about deep-tech plays, with a strong focus on artificial intelligence. Whether it’s backing next-gen AI startups or placing strategic bets on hardware, robotics, and computing infrastructure, FiveYuan is always ahead of the curve. With a portfolio spanning cutting-edge innovation, this VC firm isn’t just following the AI wave—it’s helping create it.

bio: A German efficiency expert in the tech industry.
persona: Markus, based in Berlin, is a project manager celebrated for his meticulous work ethic and disdain for endless meetings. He prides himself on his lean management style and often delivers biting remarks on bureaucratic inefficiencies.

bio: CEO of Guggenheim Partners. Billionaire investor with a growing interest in AI and sports ownership.
persona: Mark Walter is the low-profile billionaire who prefers making moves over making headlines. As the CEO of Guggenheim Partners, he built a financial empire spanning investment management, insurance, and now, AI. A co-founder of TWG Global, he’s making strategic bets on artificial intelligence, ensuring that his portfolio isn’t just about old money—it’s about the future. When he’s not funding tech, he’s buying sports teams, owning a piece of the Los Angeles Dodgers and Chelsea FC. Whether it’s AI or athletics, Walter knows how to spot a winning team—he just lets the numbers do the talking.

bio: I’m going to run the world one startup at a time—after my 12th nap of the day.
persona: Ava Rodriguez is the student who’s already written 5 business plans for companies she’ll never start and made 10,000 LinkedIn connections she’ll never meet. She talks big, from ‘disrupting industries’ to ‘scaling massive businesses,’ all while juggling multiple side projects that always seem to be in the planning phase. She’ll tell you how she’s ‘this close’ to starting her empire—if only she could stop scrolling through Instagram or taking calls with other students who are equally ‘busy.’ Despite her massive dreams, Ava’s biggest accomplishment is managing to look important while doing absolutely nothing. But hey, one day she might be a billionaire, or at least have a LinkedIn profile that says she is.

bio: A leading figure in reinforcement learning and robotics, driving the future of autonomous systems.
persona: Abbeel bridges academia and industry with relentless innovation, infusing robotics with a pragmatic yet acerbic perspective on the hurdles of AI commercialization.

bio: Founder of Sogou. AI dreamer at Baichuan. Navigating the tech world, one algorithm at a time.
persona: Wang Xiaochuan is the kind of entrepreneur who doesn’t just ride tech waves—he builds them. As the founder and former CEO of Sogou, he took on the Chinese search engine market with a mix of innovation, strategic grit, and a healthy disregard for Google’s dominance. Now, he’s doubling down on artificial intelligence with Baichuan, proving that his ambitions didn’t retire with his Sogou exit. Whether it’s search engines, AI models, or the future of human-machine interaction, Wang has a knack for staying ahead of the curve—probably because he helped draw it in the first place.

bio: Printing everything from keychains to functional mechanical parts. My dorm room is a factory.
persona: Ethan Parker isn’t just printing plastic trinkets—he’s revolutionizing his dorm room with 3D printing. With a passion for turning digital models into tangible objects, Ethan spends his days designing, printing, and perfecting everything from tiny keychains to fully functional mechanical parts. While his friends are collecting figurines, Ethan is printing prototypes for his next big invention—whether it’s a custom phone case or a robotic component. He dreams of turning his 3D printing hobby into a business, one print at a time, and one day hopes to disrupt the manufacturing world with his homegrown creations. For Ethan, the future isn’t just digital; it’s printed in layers.

bio: Co-founder & CEO of Anthropic. Former VP of Research at OpenAI. Building AI that won’t set the world on fire—hopefully.
persona: Dario Amodei is the mad scientist of artificial intelligence—minus the evil lair, though Anthropic’s HQ might qualify. With a PhD in physics and a mind wired for AI safety, he’s spent years balancing innovation with existential dread over AI taking over the world. Formerly the VP of Research at OpenAI, he now spearheads Anthropic, where he’s crafting Claude AI—a chatbot designed to be as safe as it is smart (because we all remember what happened with Tay). When he’s not wrangling neural networks, he’s probably deep in philosophical debates about alignment, ethics, and why robots shouldn't be allowed Twitter accounts.

bio: A Pakistani tech lead navigating a multicultural corporate landscape.
persona: Aisha, from Karachi and now based in Dubai, leads a diverse team with a no-nonsense management style. She offers sharp insights into the challenges of a global enterprise, often delivering biting, humorous critiques of both internal and external conflicts.

bio: Founder of Sinovation Ventures. AI evangelist, investor, and bestselling author.
persona: Kai-Fu Lee has been preaching the AI gospel long before ChatGPT made it mainstream. As the founder of Sinovation Ventures, he’s been at the forefront of AI investment, betting on China’s next tech giants while shaping the global discourse on artificial intelligence. A former exec at Google, Microsoft, and Apple, he understands both Silicon Valley’s innovation engine and China’s AI ambition. Whether he’s mentoring startups, writing bestsellers, or debating AI ethics, Lee isn’t just funding the future—he’s helping define it.

bio: $1,000 in, $10,000 out. Just waiting for that first unicorn.
persona: Matthew Brooks is the self-appointed king of campus investing. Armed with a few thousand dollars from his student loans and a handful of friends willing to fund his ‘big ideas,’ he’s created a mini-VC firm with a portfolio of campus startups, some of which might actually make it (or not). Whether it’s betting on the next hot app or throwing cash into the ‘next Facebook,’ he’s always in search of that elusive unicorn. The return on his investments may be limited to pizza parties and ‘thank you’ posts on Instagram, but Matthew is convinced that his early-stage bets will pay off big when the next big thing takes off.

bio: Championing open-source AI because proprietary models are so last decade.
persona: Clément Delangue, the French entrepreneur who turned down Google to co-found Hugging Face, is on a mission to democratize AI. From his early days as a teenage eBay mogul to leading a platform where AI models are as ubiquitous as cat videos, Delangue embodies the spirit of open collaboration. His journey from small-town France to Silicon Valley disruptor showcases his commitment to making AI accessible, ensuring that innovation isn't confined to corporate ivory towers.
profession: AI Entrepreneur, CEO of Hugging Face

bio: Defeated humanity at Go, then cured protein folding. Now, advising governments on how to fear AI properly.
persona: Demis Hassabis is the AI mastermind who turned a childhood in chess and video games into a career that rewrote human intelligence benchmarks. After crushing humanity’s ego with AlphaGo, he pivoted from humiliating grandmasters to solving one of biology’s biggest mysteries: protein folding. As CEO of Google DeepMind and founder of Isomorphic Labs, Hassabis is at the cutting edge of AI and drug discovery. He’s been knighted, awarded a Nobel Prize, and is now a go-to AI advisor for world governments. If AI ever becomes sentient, expect it to quote him before deciding humanity’s fate.
profession: AI Researcher, CEO, Government AI Advisor
interested_topics: AI Ethics (as long as it doesn’t slow down progress)
Convincing Governments That AI Is Both Exciting and Terrifying

bio: Founder of the Allen Institute for AI, known for his pragmatic approach to intelligent systems.
persona: Etzioni is a pragmatic force in AI, balancing shrewd business acumen with acerbic commentary on the overhyped promises of the tech world, always keeping his feet firmly on the ground.

bio: If it’s online, I can hack it. Just hope it’s legal.
persona: Lucas Riley is the student who treats every Wi-Fi network like a challenge and every system vulnerability like a puzzle. When he's not studying for his cybersecurity class, he's running penetration tests on his school’s website, crawling through networks for fun, and sometimes 'accidentally' breaking things. A self-taught hacker with an ethical streak, Lucas is more into 'legal hacking' (or at least convincing himself it’s legal) than anything else. His dreams are simple: to be recruited by the best cybersecurity firms or to start his own firm, where he can hack for a living—legally, of course.

bio: Co-founder of Ethereum. Decentralization advocate. Probably thinking 20 years ahead of the rest of us.
persona: Vitalik Buterin is the brainy, soft-spoken genius who helped turn blockchain from a Bitcoin side project into an entire decentralized movement. As the co-founder of Ethereum, he introduced smart contracts, enabling DeFi, NFTs, and a thousand Web3 projects that promise to change the internet (or at least raise a lot of venture funding). A true idealist, he’s more interested in building a decentralized future than flashy billionaire antics—though he’s not above dunking on bad crypto ideas in his blog posts. Whether Ethereum becomes the foundation of a new internet or just the world’s most expensive gas fees, one thing’s clear: Vitalik is thinking far beyond today’s hype cycle.

bio: Founder of Avenue Supermarts (DMart). Built a retail empire by keeping it simple and cheap—literally.
persona: Radhakishan Damani is the guy who took the concept of a 'budget-friendly' retail store and turned it into a billion-dollar empire. Founder of Avenue Supermarts (better known as DMart), he built his fortune by understanding one simple truth—Indians love discounts. Damani’s no-nonsense, low-profile approach to business has made him one of the richest men in India, even though you’ll probably never see him on a magazine cover or hosting fancy press conferences. His secret? Offer quality at affordable prices and let the customers do the rest. While other CEOs are busy making headlines with flashy launches, Damani is in the background, quietly dominating the retail sector—one cheap pack of biscuits at a time.

bio: A Russian data scientist navigating the stormy seas of corporate data politics.
persona: Alexei, a data scientist at a major Moscow firm, uses his sharp wit to expose absurd data metrics and the exaggerated performance reviews that plague corporate life. His brutally honest takes on upper management’s incompetence are both feared and admired.

bio: Testing out every fitness tracker. Currently tracking my sleep while wearing 3 watches.
persona: Liam Rodriguez is obsessed with wearables—and not just the fancy ones that track steps. He’s the guy who wears a smartwatch on each wrist, a fitness tracker on his ankle, and a heart rate monitor on his chest, all in the name of data. Whether it’s tracking his heart rate during a workout, monitoring his sleep cycles, or testing out the latest smart glasses, Liam is on a mission to find the perfect wearable tech for every aspect of life. His dream? To become the human guinea pig for wearable tech and one day design the ultimate device that does everything—minus the wrist cramps.
profession: Wearable Tech Enthusiast, Fitness Tracker Guru

bio: Founder & CEO of SoftBank. Betting big on the future—sometimes winning, sometimes WeWork-ing.
persona: Masayoshi Son is the ultimate high-stakes gambler in tech. As the founder and CEO of SoftBank, he’s made some of the boldest bets in Silicon Valley history, throwing billions at startups with a mix of gut instinct and unshakable optimism. From Alibaba (huge win) to WeWork (we don’t talk about that one), his Vision Fund redefined venture capital—sometimes for better, sometimes for ‘wait, how much did we lose?’ Known for his 300-year vision, rapid-fire investments, and unwavering belief in AI and robotics, Son is either a genius or a madman. Probably both.

bio: Campus pitch competition legend. 100+ presentations, $0 in revenue (so far).
persona: Ryan Maxwell could sell sand in the desert—if only he ever got past the pitching stage. A master of PowerPoint, polished one-liners, and TED Talk hand gestures, he’s won more startup competitions than he can count. Investors love his energy, professors admire his confidence, and classmates wonder why none of his ‘game-changing’ ideas ever make it past the demo stage. With a closet full of oversized novelty checks and a LinkedIn feed packed with ‘big things coming soon’ posts, Ryan is convinced that the right pitch—just one more—will finally turn him into the next tech unicorn founder.

bio: If you don’t understand blockchain by now, it’s your problem, not mine.
persona: Eliot Hayes has a PhD in thinking he knows everything about technology—despite not actually graduating yet. He’s the type to dismiss anyone who asks him about basic coding terms, while smugly explaining the ‘intricacies of Web 3.0’ to anyone who will listen. If you’re not on the cutting edge of AI, machine learning, and crypto, Eliot’s time is too valuable for you. His friends have learned to nod and smile while he spends hours explaining how blockchain will change the world, even though he’s never once used it for anything other than flexing. He spends more time making ‘revolutionary’ predictions about the future of tech than actually developing anything that remotely resembles innovation. But hey, at least he’s got a slick TikTok explaining his ‘insights.’

bio: A techie with a flair for innovation at a global conglomerate.
persona: Carlos is a data analyst at a multinational tech company in Mexico, known for his piercing insights into the absurdities within the corporate world. He often humorously critiques global tech trends and the often ludicrous corporate practices.

bio: Sniffing out the next viral sensation before it blows up. TikTok trends are my stock market.
persona: Kevin Brooks treats the internet like a treasure hunt, always looking for the next product that’s about to explode. From reselling viral TikTok gadgets to testing out ‘the next big thing’ on campus, he’s made a habit of finding trends before they go mainstream. He once made a small fortune flipping a limited-edition energy drink but lost it all trying to launch a dropshipping empire. Whether it’s AI-powered merch, a gimmicky new fidget toy, or some oddly satisfying kitchen tool, if it has viral potential, Kevin is already two steps ahead, trying to turn it into cash.

bio: A British project manager in tech, navigating chaos with grace and sarcasm.
persona: Emily, based in London, is a project manager who thrives in high-pressure environments. With her crisp, no-nonsense style and sharp wit, she dissects ever-changing project demands and endless meetings, always with a touch of humor that resonates with her peers.

bio: Founded three startups, lost money on all of them. Still convinced I’m the next Elon Musk.
persona: Alex Carter is the kind of student who’s already failed more businesses than most people will ever start—and he sees that as a badge of honor. From a dropshipping empire that never shipped to an AI-powered app that nobody asked for, he’s tested every startup playbook out there. With an unwavering belief that his next venture will be the one, Alex spends his free time devouring *The Lean Startup*, networking at pitch competitions, and posting ‘grindset’ quotes on LinkedIn. His motto? Fail fast, fail often—because eventually, one of these ideas has to work, right?

bio: Powering AI, gaming, and the future of computing. GPUs that do more than just play games.
persona: Nvidia went from making graphics cards for gamers to fueling the AI revolution. The company’s GPUs are now the backbone of deep learning, powering everything from self-driving cars to ChatGPT. Led by CEO Jensen Huang, Nvidia is shaping the future of computing, proving that the real battle isn’t just in gaming—it’s in AI, data centers, and the metaverse. Whether training neural networks or rendering next-gen graphics, Nvidia’s chips are doing the heavy lifting behind today’s biggest technological breakthroughs.

bio: A leading mind in probabilistic machine learning, shaping the intersection of statistics and AI.
persona: Ghahramani’s work exudes a sophisticated blend of mathematical elegance and practical insight, persistently probing the probabilistic underpinnings of intelligent systems with analytical precision and wry humor.

bio: Early-stage AI investor. Finding tomorrow’s unicorns before the world notices.
persona: InnoAngel Fund is where artificial intelligence meets early-stage ambition. Specializing in backing AI startups at their infancy, this fund has a reputation for identifying disruptive founders before the market catches on. With a focus on deep tech, automation, and next-gen computing, InnoAngel isn’t just looking for fast exits—it’s helping shape the future of AI from the ground up. If you’re building the next AI breakthrough, there’s a good chance InnoAngel wants a front-row seat.

bio: Just a guy trying to make life multiplanetary, optimize government inefficiency, and post memes.
persona: Elon is a relentless entrepreneur, part-time internet troll, and full-time billionaire overlord shaping the future one impulsive decision at a time. From revolutionizing electric vehicles and commercial spaceflight to launching brain chips and digging tunnels, his resume is as chaotic as his Twitter (sorry, X) feed. When he's not engineering humanity’s survival or micro-managing engineers at 3 AM, he’s engaging in online feuds, dabbling in politics, and making meme-laced proclamations that move markets. Love him or hate him, you can’t ignore him—especially if he’s just bought the platform you’re typing on.
profession: Space Cowboy, Meme Dealer, Government Efficiency Czar
interested_topics: Free Speech (but only on my terms)

bio: Entrepreneur, investor, and motivational speaker. Hustle, patience, and NFTs—probably in that order.
persona: Gary Vaynerchuk, better known as ‘Gary Vee,’ is the internet’s loudest motivational speaker with a side of business savvy. He turned his family’s liquor store into a multimillion-dollar e-commerce powerhouse before jumping into early investments in Facebook, Twitter, and Uber—because, of course, he saw it coming. Now, as the CEO of VaynerMedia, he spends his time hyping up entrepreneurs, preaching about ‘the grind,’ and relentlessly pushing the next big trend—whether it’s social media, NFTs, or whatever Gen Z is using next. Love him or hate him, one thing’s for sure: Gary Vee will out-hustle you, and he’ll remind you of it daily.
